results.title: The Back health program
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Technical and Further Education and New South Wales. Occupational Health, Safety and Workers Compensation Unit
results.brief_description: Amanda Gore is renowned for her work in occuaptional health. It is true that many workers will suffer from back-related health problems. The purpose of this program is to develop better back health and preventative strategies to minimise the risk of back injury. The videocassette and booklet are divided into five modules: 1. How back pain develops. 2. Sitting. 3. Lifting. 4. Preventing back injury. 5. Exercises. The three posters in the package are: 1. Guidelines for lifting. 2. Your body’s warning signs. 3. Back exercises. By following the simple and effective exercises, the risk of back injury can be reduced.

results.title: The Back-breaking leaf
results.creator_credit: Terence Macartney-Filgate, Tom Daly, Wolf Koenig, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Smokers say it’s relaxing, but tobacco harvesters call it “the back-breaking leaf.” Here is a graphic picture of the tobacco harvest in southwestern Ontario, presented from points of view of the transient field workers who move in for a brief bonanza when the leaves are ripe, and of the farmers who depend solely on this crop. A 1959 black and white production. Camera by: Terence Macartney-Filgate, Music by: Eldon Rathburn, Commentary by: Stanley Jackson. (Awards: Cannes; New York; Antwerp.)

results.title: The Baby of Macon
results.creator_credit: Peter Greenaway, Kees Kasander, La Sept, UGC Images and Channel Four
results.brief_description: Peter Greenaway’s film is visually sumptuous and confronting. Inspired by images of billboards featuring young children as icons, Greenaway’s film is set in the seventeenth century where child martyrs were similarly exploited. Rape, death, dismemberment occur when a miraculous child is the subject of a play that becomes too real. Stars Ralph Fiennes and Julia Ormond.

results.title: The Baby Boomers' Picture Show
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, ABC-TV (Australia) and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Inspired by the book “Baby Boomers” by Helen Townsend, “The Baby Boomers’ Picture Show” re-creates the sensations, the thrills and the horrors of growing up in Australia in the 1950’s and 1960’s.

results.title: The Baboon troop
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown and Educational Development Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man: a course of study”.
Explores the social structure of members of a baboon troop. Shows the role of the male as the protector and central figure, the females’ bonds of affection for their offspring, and the establishment of the dominance hierarchy among juveniles.

results.title: The Babadook
results.brief_description: A single mother, plagued by the death of her husband, battles with her son’s fear of a monster lurking in the house, but soon discovers a sinister presence all around her in this acclaimed debut from Jennifer Kent.

results.title: The Aztecs
results.brief_description: Describes the culture of the pre-Aztecs civilizations as evidenced in ruins, carvings, and murals of Tenochtitlan, Teotihuacan, Tula and Tenayuca. Emphasizes the important role of religion in the lives of Aztec people and re-enacts at Totihuacan, a religious ceremony as it might have been performed in 1500.

results.title: The Aymara: a case study in social stratification
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Coast Community College District
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Faces of culture”.
For centuries the social structure of Bolivia consisted of three classes, a white oligarchy, the Spanish speaking mestizo middle class and an Indian peasantry. The 1952 revolution did much to change this, but the basic structure still exists, particularly in rural backwaters such as are portrayed in this video. In Ayata and Vitocoto the class system is still horrifically alive and well, as the despised peasantry labour for the mestizo landowners and priests for little or no pay and no hope of improvement due to inequalities in educational opportunities and health care. Narrated by David Carradine.

results.title: The Axedale project
results.brief_description: The construction of a bailey bridge and approaches, as a temporary crossing over the Campaspe River at Axedale to serve traffic while the existing bridge is taken out of service for provision of a new superstructure.

results.title: The Axe and the lamp
results.creator_credit: John Halas, British Film Institute and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: Peter Breugel’s painting “The Netherlandish Proverbs” illustrates over one hundred proverbs and allegorises a whole world of sin and folly as relevant today as in the 16th century.
